name: 蔡銘修
objective: This course helps the learners recognize the syntax, style, and organization as far as the papers on English writings are concerned.
schedule:
01 03/04 Intro(research topic)
02 03/11 Research- Abstract
03 03/18 Research Method 1
04 03/25 Research- Introduction 1
05 04/01 Research- Introduction 2
06 04/08 Research- Literature Review & Introduction Practice
07 04/15 Definition of terms
08 04/22 Research- Method 2
09 04/29 Midterm Week
10 05/06 Endnote and Turnitin (bring your own laptop)
11 05/13 Research Result 
12 05/20 Research Discussion, Conclusion and Suggest
13 05/27 Final Presentation Preparation
14 06/03 Final Presentation-1
15 06/10 Final Presentation-2
16 06/17 Final Presentation-3
17 06/24 Final Presentation-4
18 07/01 Final Exam Week (final paper due)
scorePolicy:
Grading:
1. Attendance 15%
2. Abstract 20%  
3. Final Presentation 25%
4. Final Research Paper 40% 
    - 12 font, 1.5 spaces
    - suggest full paper (7 pages)
5. Additional grade 5% (papers are accepted in International journal or conference)
materials:
Academic Writing for Graduate Students 3/e
Author: John M. Swales, & Christine B. Feak
Publisher: Michigan Press
Publication date: 2013/3
ISBN: 9780472034758
